questions.question: Why is it a dumb idea to use the same password on multiple sites?
questions.incorrect: Because I lose access to multiple accounts if I forget my password.
questions.correct: Because if a hacker obtains the password, he or she can get into my more sensitive accounts, such as my e-mail or bank account.

questions.question: Why is your e-mail account one of the most sensitive accounts you got?
questions.incorrect: Because it is one of the most frequently used accounts of mine.
questions.correct: Because if a hacker gets access to my e-mail account, he or she can use the reset function on other sites to get access to those too.

questions.question: Is it a good idea to write your password on a piece of paper to remember it?
questions.correct: If it helps me use unique passwords and I keep it save.

questions.question: Should I keep my password on a post-it note on my screen?
Why should I use symbols in my password?
questions.correct: Because it raises the number of passwords for a hacker to try from 2 billion to 513,798 billion

questions.question: Why should I change password a few times per year?
questions.incorrect: Because it helps me forget my older passwords.
questions.correct: Because a company might have been hacked and lost your password.

questions.question: Could I use a poem to remember my password?
questions.incorrect: Yes. I should use the first few words of something from a famous Shakespeare play!
questions.correct: Yes. I should use a personal poem and use the first and second letter of a few words, and add some numbers and symbols!

questions.question: Should I use my email address as a password?
questions.incorrect: Yes. Since it is unique, no one will guess it.

questions.question: Why should I use a password manager?
questions.incorrect: Because it helps me fill in passwords.
questions.correct: Because it helps me remember my unique, complex passwords.

questions.question: Should I use web sites to test my passwords strength?
questions.incorrect: Yes. Those web sites are great to find out if my password is strong or not!
questions.correct: No, since it might save my password.
